languageKey.label: Layar layer source content description.
Each records describes a layer. Layer data is retrieved from the specified table and fields.
Contains the layer name used to uniquely identify this layer.
The layer name is used by the Layar API to identify the source.
Table used as provider for POI data.
System folder where the POI data is stored.
If no folder is selected, all records from the database table are read.
Field name containing the POI title.
TypoScript used to generate the second line of POI details.
The TypoScript definition is executed in the context of the POI record as a TEXT content object.
TypoScript used to generate the third line of POI details.
The TypoScript definition is executed in the context of the POI record as a TEXT content object.
TypoScript used to generate the forth line of POI details.
The TypoScript definition is executed in the context of the POI record as a TEXT content object.
TypoScript used to generate the attribution line of POI details.
The TypoScript definition is executed in the context of the POI record as a TEXT content object.
TypoScript used to generate the action's URIs.

The TypoScript definition is executed in the context of the POI record as a TEXT content object. The resulting content MUST be a list of URIs. The separator is the comma. An empty URI is ignored with its same index label.
TypoScript used to generate the action's labels.

The TypoScript definition is executed in the context of the POI record as a TEXT content object. The resulting content MUST be a list of labels. The separator is the comma. An empty label is ignored with its same index URI.
Field name providing a picture illustrating the POI or the path to the picture.
The path can be recognized as full URL, absolute URL, site root relative path, or an uploaded file name. The last case works only if the path comes from a field.
Field name containing the POI type or its value.
The value can only be in the range 0 to 3 inclusives.
Field name(s) containing the coordinates. Names are separated by comma.

If only one field name, the field contains the latitude and the longitude in degrees separated by a comma. If two field names, the first field is the latitude in degrees and the second is longitude in degrees.
